content:
A BILL to recognise same-sex marriage has failed in Japan’s parliament, exposing a widening divide between the views of its politicians and the values of its people. For some officials, Burundi’s election tax is an excuse for extortion; for some citizens, a reason to flee the country. And, why you should be circumspect about that next promotion opportunity . Runtime: 21 min

Listen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneIn
